Description: Glazed composition daisy button/bead (?). Front has dished face with seventeen rounded petals. Back is steeply rounded, hemispherical, with attachment hole at the back cut out of a rounded stump. Cream glaze with yellow on eye of daisy. Core creamy, porous, medium texture.
Curator's comments: Quite unlike the 'daisy' buttons found in Archaic Greek contexts of the end of seventh century and into sixth century, which are all products of same factory. See disucssion in Webb 2016, 76. Webb, V. 2016, Samos XIII: Faience Material from the Samos Heraion excavations, Wiesbaden.
Xia type PD93. Xia, N. 2014, Ancient Egyptian Beads, Heidelberg.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (QG.09)
